casebody.data:
THE TOWNSHIP COMMITTEE OF THE TOWNSHIP OF LITTLE EGG HARBOR IN THE COUNTY OF OCEAN, PLAINTIFF-APPELLANT, v. AMERICAN TELEPHONE & TELEGRAPH COMPANY AND THE BOROUGH OF TUCKERTON, DEFENDANTS-RESPONDENTS. Superior Court of New Jersey Appellate Division Argued May 18, 1988 Decided June 7, 1988.

Before Judges GAULKIN, GRUCCIO and D’ANNUNZIO.

Edward V. Murachanian argued the cause for appellant (Hiering & Hoffman, attorneys). Michael J. Guerriero argued the cause for respondent American Telephone & Telegraph Company. Terry F. Brady argued the cause for respondent Borough of Tuckerton (Gilmore & Monahan, attorneys). PER CURIAM.

The judgment is affirmed substantially for the reasons expressed by Judge Lario in his opinion reported at 9 N.J.Tax 314 (Tax Ct.1987).
